sentence.Network_en: I find public squalor very saddening.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from Latin, from squalere 'be dirty'

entry.def: You can refer to very dirty, unpleasant conditions as squalor .

example.ex: He was out of work and living in squalor.

auth_sentence.content: Without the Public things they provide, we would mostly be living in squalor.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Without the Public things they provide, we would mostly be living in squalor.

Sentence.sentence: Those factors are more than enough to make up for the squalor (肮脏), disease and spectacular poverty that those same migrants must often at first endure when they become urban dwellers.
It aggravates the squalor of cities

means.word_mean: 污秽, 肮脏, 邋遢

sentences.en: a beautiful garden amid the squalor of the slums
sentences.cn: 位于肮脏的贫民窟中的美丽花园

sentences.en: He was born in squalor next to London’s docks.
sentences.cn: 他出生在伦敦码头附近肮脏的地区。
